text: Devon Jerome Kelly-Evans (born 21 September 1996) is an English football who plays as a midfielder for Nuneaton Borough ==Career== Kelly-Evans made his professional debut as a substitute on 23 August 2016 in a 6-1 Football League Cup defeat to Norwich City, coming on to replace Ben Stevenson after 67 minutes. Towards the end of the 2016–17 season, Devon Kelly-Evans was sent out on loan to Nuneaton Town, where he made 11 appearances and scored two goals. On 12 September 2017, Devon Kelly-Evans made his league debut for Coventry City, replacing Stuart Beavon in the 87th minute of a 2–0 win over Carlisle United. He then scored his first senior goal for the Sky Blues in a 2–0 over Exeter City on 23 September 2017. He was released by Coventry at the end of the 2017–18 season. He signed for Nuneaton Borough on 15 June 2018 on a two- year deal. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align: center" |+Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|FA Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="3"|Coventry City |2016–17 |League One |0||0||0||0||1||0||0||0||1||0 |- |2017–18 |League Two |14||1||1||0||1||0||1Appearance in EFL Trophy||0||17||1 |- !colspan="2"|Coventry City !14!!1!!1!!0!!2!!0!!1!!0!!18!!1 |- |Nuneaton Town (loans) |2016–17 |National League North |11||2||0||0||~||~||0||0||11||2 |- !colspan="3" | Career totals !25!!3!!1!!0!!2!!0!!1!!0!!29!!3 |} ==Personal life== Kelly-Evans is the twin brother of fellow former Coventry City player Dion Kelly-Evans. ==References== ==External links== * Devon Kelly- Evans player profile at ccfc.co.uk * * * N.b. The Press Association has mis- attributed an appearance made on 10 September 2016 by Dion Kelly-Evans to Devon Kelly-Evans.
